org.dockbox.selene.core.annotations.entity

Annotation Type Property


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface Property
    The interface to provide custom information to a object field when creating a object using org.dockbox.selene.core.util.ReflectionUtil#tryCreate(Class, Function, boolean, Provision)

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String value
      The alternative identifier for the field.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> accepts
      Marks the accepted value of the field.
      java.lang.String setter
      The alternative setter for the field.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        The alternative identifier for the field. For example a field called firstName which is being injected into by a property called fn could like like the following example: 
         
 \@Property("fn")
 private String firstName;
        Returns:
        the alternative identifier for the field

      • setter

        public abstract java.lang.String setter
        The alternative setter for the field. When defined org.dockbox.selene.core.util.ReflectionUtil#tryCreate(Class, Function, boolean, Provision) will first attempt to find a method which accepts a value of the type of the provided value. This means it is possible to directly apply a given String value to a Integer field. Note that type differences are only accepted when defined with accepts(). 
         
 \@Property(setter = "setValueString")
 private Integer id;

 public void setValueString(String value) {
 this.id = Integer.parseInt(value);
 }
        Returns:
        the name of the setter
        Default:
        ""

      • accepts

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> accepts
        Marks the accepted value of the field. When defined this allows setter() to accept a type different from the field type.
        Returns:
        the type to accept
        Default:
        java.lang.Void.class
